SEARCH
Module com.gluonhq.richtextarea
Package com.gluonhq.richtextarea.model

Class UnitBuffer

java.lang.Object
com.gluonhq.richtextarea.model.UnitBuffer
public class UnitBuffer extends Object
A UnitBuffer is a collection of units and related operations, like getting their internal or exportable text. A PieceTable uses two buffers of units, original and addition, but the UnitBuffer can be used elsewhere as a rich string. In its simplest implementation, this would be a String class. An example of more complex units is: "Emoji: üòÄ!", where the unit buffer will have three units: [TU{'Emoji: '}, EU{1F600}, TU{'!'}], and the internal text will be: "Emoji: ‚Å£!". Note that the length of the original text is 10, while the internal length, after replacing the emoji characters with the anchor is 9.

  • Method Details

    • getText

      public String getText()
      Gets the exportable text of the unit buffer. It is useful for clipboard or serializing the document, but shouldn't be used internally to do Piece operations
      Returns:
      a string with the exportable text content

    • getInternalText

      public String getInternalText()
      Gets the internal text of the unit buffer. For text units, matches the exportable text. For non-text units, this is used as an anchor point
      Returns:
      a string with the internal text representation

    • length

      public int length()
      Gets the internal length of the unit buffer. Useful for Piece operations
      Returns:
      an integer value of the internal number of positions that the unit spans

    • append

      public void append(Unit unit)
      Adds a new unit to the buffer
      Parameters:
      unit - the unit that is added

    • append

      public void append(List<Unit> units)
      Adds a list of units to the buffer
      Parameters:
      units - a list of units to be added

    • getUnitList

      public List<Unit> getUnitList()
      Gives the list of units of this buffer
      Returns:
      the list of units

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Check if the buffer is empty or not
      Returns:
      true if the list of units is null or empty

    • getUnitWithRange

      public Unit getUnitWithRange(int start, int end)
      Finds the unit that contains a range of document coordinates. Convenience method to find the unit that a piece belongs to.
      Parameters:
      start - the initial value of the range
      end - the end value of the range
      Returns:
      the unit that has this range or an empty TextUnit

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • convertTextToUnits

      public static UnitBuffer convertTextToUnits(String text)
      Utility method that parses an external text that might contain emoji unicode characters and returns a UnitBuffer
      Parameters:
      text - a string that might contain emoji unicode characters
      Returns:
      a UnitBuffer with a list of units.
